1.text: After this Job opened his mouth, and cursed his day,

3.text: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said: A man child is conceived.

4.text: Let that day be turned into darkness, let not God regard it from above, and let not the light shine upon it.

5.text: Let darkness, and the shadow of death cover it, let a mist overspread it, and let it be wrapped up in bitterness.

6.text: Let a darksome whirlwind seize upon that night, let it not be counted in the days of the year, nor numbered in the months.

7.text: Let that night be solitary, and not worthy of praise.

8.text: Let them curse it who curse the day. who are ready to raise up a leviathan:

9.text: Let the stars be darkened with the mist thereof: let it expect light and not see it, nor the rising of the dawning of the day:

10.text: Because it shut not up the doors of the womb that bore me, nor took away evils from my eyes.

11.text: Why did I not die in the womb, why did I not perish when I came out of the belly?

12.text: Why received upon the knees? why suckled at the breasts ?

13.text: For now I should have been asleep and still, and should have rest in my sleep.

14.text: With kings and consuls of the earth, who build themselves solitudes:

15.text: Or with princes, that possess gold, and All their houses with silver:

16.text: Or as a hidden untimely birth I should not be, or as they that being conceived have not seen the light.

17.text: There the wicked cease from tumult, and there the wearied in strength are at rest.

18.text: And they sometime bound together without disquiet, have not heard the voice of the oppressor.

19.text: The small and great are there, and the servant is free from his master.

20.text: Why is light given to him that is in misery, and life to them that are in bitterness of soul?

21.text: That look for death, and it cometh not, as they that dig for a treasure:

22.text: And they rejoice exceedingly when they have found the grave.

23.text: To a man whose way is hidden, and God hath surrounded him with darkness?

24.text: Before I eat I sigh: and as overflowing waters, so is my roaring:

25.text: For the fear which I feared hath come upon me: and that which I was afraid of, hath befallen me.

26.text: Have I not dissembled ? have I not kept silence ? have I not been quiet? and indignation is come upon me.
